acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.8mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals (1996) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 14,100mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (i) (1997)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 23.36mg/L (5,303ppm), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (6-hour inhalation) of 4,330ppm (EHC 190 (1997)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (7,900ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.80kPa (20degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 3,608mg/kg (EHC 190 (1997)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2002): "May cause aspiration and chemical pneumonia if swallowed." Based on the fact that o-xylene is a hydrocarbon and has a dynamic viscosity of 0.86mm2/s (25degC) (CERI calculated value).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Group 3 by IARC (1999).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.12 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since rapidly degrading was unknown, it was classiied into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1307 (Xylene))

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 32degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2002) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II-III (UN#1307 (Xylene)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.62 (2004), NTP DB (Access on October 2005) and IARC (1999).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 463degC (ICSC, 2002)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on mouse teratogenicity tests (CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (i) (1997), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.62 (2004)): an increase in the incidence of a cleft palate is observed in the embryo at dosing levels toxic to dams or according to reports providing no description of the toxicity to dams.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (i) (1997): Xylene mixtures (Cas 1330-20-7) cause moderate eye irritation, and the acute effects of o-xylene on human health are considered essentially equivalent to those of xylene mixtures. The substance is considered "moderately irritating" to the eyes.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (i) (1997): Xylene mixtures (Cas 1330-20-7) cause moderate skin irritation, and the acute effects of o-xylene on human health are considered essentially equivalent to those of xylene mixtures. The substance is considered "moderately irritating" to the skin.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Data exclusively on o-xylene are limited, while the dosages of all tests exceed the guidance value.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "hypotension, lethargy, excitement of the central nervous system (at low concentrations), depression of the central nervous system (at high concentrations)" (EHC 190 (1997)). Narcotic influence is observed, with the biphasic effect on the central nervous system also included in narcotic influence.
